title: Graph Editor Node Drag-and-Drop Functionality
description: Verify that users can drag nodes from the sidebar and drop them onto the graph editor canvas, and the nodes appear correctly.

steps.description: Navigate to the Graph Editor page.
Drag each type of available node (RAGNode, ToolNode, LLMNode, CodeNode) from the sidebar to the canvas.
Check that the node appears on the canvas at the drop location for each node type.

title: Graph Editor Node Connection Management
description: Verify that users can create and delete connections between nodes and the connections update visually and in the backend.

steps.description: Add two nodes to the graph editor canvas.
Connect the output of the first node to the input of the second node.
Verify the connection is visually rendered and registered in the graph state.
Delete the connection.
Verify the connection is removed visually and from the graph state.

title: Graph Editor Graph Save and Load
description: Validate that graph configurations can be saved and later reloaded accurately with all nodes and connections intact.

steps.description: Create a graph with multiple nodes and connections.
Save the graph configuration via the frontend save functionality.
Reload the graph editor page and load the saved graph.
Verify that all nodes, connections, and properties appear as saved, matching the original configuration.

title: Graph Execution Trigger and Backend Integration
description: Verify that running a graph sends the correct execution request to the backend and the response is handled properly.

steps.description: Create or load a valid graph with executable nodes.
Click the 'Run' or 'Execute' button on the Graph Editor.
Verify a backend API call is made with correct graph data and nodes execution order.
Check that the frontend displays execution results or status updates based on backend response.

title: RAG Dashboard Document Upload Success
description: Verify that users can upload documents to the knowledge base successfully via the RAG dashboard.

steps.description: Navigate to the RAG Dashboard.
Upload a valid document file using the upload interface.
Verify the document is uploaded with a success status and added to the knowledge base list.

title: RAG Dashboard Document Upload Invalid File Handling
description: Verify that uploading invalid or unsupported document formats results in appropriate error feedback.

steps.description: Navigate to the RAG Dashboard.
Attempt to upload an unsupported file format or corrupted document.
Verify the system shows an error message indicating invalid upload and prevents adding the document.

title: RAG Dashboard Retrieval Test Functionality
description: Test retrieval of uploaded documents to ensure knowledge base returns accurate responses.

steps.description: Upload a known document to the knowledge base.
Use the retrieval test feature to query content known to exist in the uploaded document.
Verify the returned information matches the query and is relevant to the document content.

title: MCP Dashboard Server Registration and Validation
description: Verify users can register MCP server connections and that the system validates server details correctly.

steps.description: Navigate to MCP Dashboard.
Input valid MCP server connection details and submit registration.
Verify the server connection is registered successfully and appears in the list.
Attempt registration with invalid or unreachable server details.
Verify the system rejects the registration with an appropriate error message.

title: MCP Dashboard AI Tools Listing
description: Verify the MCP dashboard can fetch and display the list of available AI tools from registered MCP servers.

steps.description: Ensure MCP server(s) are registered.
Navigate to MCP Dashboard tool listing section.
Verify the available AI tools for each MCP server are fetched from backend and listed correctly.

title: Fine-tuning Dashboard Job Creation and Submission
description: Verify that users can create new fine-tuning jobs by submitting valid training data and configuration.

steps.description: Navigate to Fine-tuning Dashboard.
Create a new fine-tuning job by uploading valid training dataset and specifying parameters.
Verify the job is created successfully and appears in the job list with status 'Pending' or 'Running'.

title: Fine-tuning Dashboard Job Status Monitoring
description: Verify that fine-tuning job statuses update correctly from Pending to Running to Completed or Failed.

steps.description: Create and submit a fine-tuning job.
Verify the job status updates in real-time or on refresh according to backend processing.
Verify various statuses including Running, Completed, and Failed are handled and displayed correctly.

title: API Backend Endpoint Functional Verification
description: Verify that all backend API endpoints respond correctly to valid create, upload, register, execute, and list requests with appropriate status codes and payloads.

steps.description: Send valid requests to all key API endpoints (graph execution, fine-tuning job management, RAG processing, MCP server config).
Verify HTTP status codes indicate success (200, 201) and response bodies contain expected data.

title: System Handles Invalid User Inputs Gracefully
description: Verify the system detects invalid inputs across all dashboards and editor forms and shows appropriate error messages without system crashes or invalid states.

steps.description: Input invalid or malformed data in graph editor node properties, RAG uploads, MCP server details, and fine-tuning job parameters.
Verify the system validates inputs, disables submit if invalid, and displays clear error messages inline or as alerts.

title: Frontend-Backend Integration and CORS Verification
description: Ensure the React frontend and FastAPI backend communicate without errors, observing proper CORS headers for cross-origin requests during regular operations and Docker startup.

steps.description: Start frontend and backend services via Docker.
Perform typical user flows (graph editing, RAG upload, MCP registration, fine-tuning job creation).
Monitor network requests to verify no CORS errors or 4xx/5xx API errors occur and application functions smoothly.

title: Edge Case: Empty Graph Execution Handling
description: Verify that attempting to execute an empty graph or graph with no executable nodes results in an informative error and no backend execution calls.

steps.description: Open the Graph Editor with no nodes or only non-executable nodes.
Attempt to run/execute the graph.
Verify the user is shown an informative error that no execution can proceed and no API call is made.

title: Edge Case: Large Document Upload in RAG Dashboard
description: Test uploading a very large document file to the RAG knowledge base and verify system handles it correctly without performance degradation or crash.

steps.description: Navigate to RAG Dashboard.
Upload a very large document that is within allowed size limits.
Verify the upload succeeds, system remains responsive, and the knowledge base updates accordingly.

title: Edge Case: Duplicate MCP Server Registration
description: Verify that attempting to register a duplicate MCP server connection is detected and prevented with a meaningful error message.

steps.description: Register a new valid MCP server connection.
Attempt to register the same MCP server connection again.
Verify the system rejects the duplicate registration and displays an appropriate error message.
